thread.title: GMP taser blind man in gun blunder
thread.title_full: GMP taser blind man in gun blunder

title: GMP taser blind man in gun blunder
text: Blind man is Tasered and arrested by police after officers mistook his folding cane for a GUN Police were called to Levenshulme, Manchester, at around 6.40 on Thursday The 43-year-old was detained by police officers before they realised their error Greater Manchester Police's Professional Standards Branch have been alerted Do you know the man who was tasered? Email paddy.dinham@mailonline.co.uk Published: 20:00 GMT, 24 February 2017 | Updated: 21:47 GMT, 24 February 2017 15 shares comments An embarrassing police gaffe saw a blind man Tasered and detained by officers after his cane was mistaken for a gun. Greater Manchester Police were called to reports of a man with a gun in Levenshulme, shortly after 6.40pm on Thursday. A force spokesman said: 'Armed response officers attended and a Taser was deployed. A 43-year-old man was detained. Greater Manchester Police were called to reports of a man with a gun on this street in Levenshulme, shortly after 6.40pm on Thursday 'Officers later discovered the man was in possession of a folding cane and he was subsequently released.' The force confirmed the man was blind. Superintendent Steve Howard, of GMP's City of Manchester Team, said: 'Officers responded quickly to the incident to ensure the safety of the community of Levenshulme. 'It has been established that there was no threat and inquiries are ongoing to fully understand the circumstances of the incident. Do you know the man who was tasered? Email paddy.dinham@mailonline.co.uk 'In line with standard procedure on occasions such as this, a referral has been made to GMP's Professional Standards Branch.' In 2012, a blind man was Tasered in Lancashire after his white stick was mistaken for a Samurai sword. The man was walking in Chorley town centre on the way to meet friends at a pub when he was Tasered and then handcuffed. Shopkeeper Tasawar Dar, who runs the Discount Master convenience store on Albert Road in Levenshulme, told the Manchester Evening News he saw armed police arriving at the scene. RELATED ARTICLES
